Title: UPDATE 1-Samsung estimates Q2 profit down 26 pct,S.Korea-Market Factors to watch July 7,Samsung estimates Q2 profit down 26 pct
Body: * Sees Q2 op profit at 3.7 trln won vs 3.9 trln wonconsensus, SEOUL, July 7 Following is a list of events inSouth Korea as well as news stories and press reports which mayinfluence financial markets.  	(Reuters News welcomes your feedback and for any queries, pleasecontact the Seoul newsroom at +822 3704 5640 or via email atkr.rtrs@gmail.com)  	WHAT IS HAPPENING IN SOUTH KOREA, TIMES LOCAL (GMT +9 HOURS):(The inclusion of diary items does not necessarily mean thatReuters will cover the event)    >Samsung Electronics , the world's , SEOUL, July 7 Samsung Electronics ,the world's top maker of memory chips and televisions, estimatedits April-June operating profit would fall 26 percent year onyear, as its LCD display business is widely expected to reportanother loss.

Title: UPDATE 3-Struggling LG slashes phone sales targets,UPDATE 5-Samsung Q2 falls as weak LCDs overshadow mobiles,UPDATE 1-Olympics-S.Korea expects huge economic boost from Winter Games,LG sees H2 smartphone sales up 40 pct, cuts 2011 handset targets,HTC limit-down on slower demand, corp governance concerns,Olympics-S.Korea expects huge economic boost from Winter Games
Body: * Cuts 2011 smartphone sales target 20 pct to 24mln units, * Estimates Q2 sales at 39 trln won vs 40 trln won consensus, PYEONGCHANG, South Korea, July 7 Shares in SouthKorean casino and resort operators and construction firms spikedon Thursday, buoyed by expectations that Pyeongchang's hostingof the 2018 Winter Olympics could pump tens of billions ofdollars into the economy., SEOUL, July 7 LG Electronics Inc , the world's No.3handset maker, expected its smartphone sales to rise by around 40 percent in thesecond half to 14 million units from the previous half, as it introduced Optimus3D on Thursday in South Korea in its latest push to turn around the loss-makinghandset business.,TAIPEI Shares of world No.5 handset maker HTC Corp  plunged on Thursday as investor looked beyond the forecast-beating quarterly net profit to concerns over a slowdown in smartphone demand and the company's corporate governance after its plan to acquire S3 Graphics., PYEONGCHANG, South Korea, July 7 Shares in SouthKorean casino and resort operators and construction firms spikedon Thursday, buoyed by expectations that Pyeongchang's hostingof the 2018 Winter Olympics could pump tens of billions ofdollars into the economy.

Title: Apple chief patent lawyer leaving: sources,Toshiba wants to be top maker of flash memory soon: president,Toshiba wants to be top maker of flash memory soon-president
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc's chief patent counsel will soon leave the company, at a time when the iPhone maker is fighting numerous legal battles around the world, according to sources familiar with the situation.,TOKYO Toshiba Corp's president said his company wanted to soon overtake South Korean rival Samsung Electronics as the world's leading maker of flash memory., TOKYO, July 12 Toshiba Corp's presidentsaid his company wanted to soon overtake South Korean rivalSamsung Electronics as the world's leading maker offlash memory.

Body: SAN FRANCISCO Google Inc's results soundly trounced Wall Street's most bullish expectations, sending its shares up 12 percent and easing concerns that its battle with Facebook and Twitter is costing too much and hindering growth. |__, July 15 Following is a list of events in SouthKorea as well as news stories and press reports which mayinfluence financial markets. (Reuters News welcomes yourfeedback and for any queries, please contact the Seoul newsroomat +822 3704 5640 or via email at kr.rtrs@gmail.com)   	Bank of Korea's revised H2 forecasts	BOK revisits its second-half economic forecasts in three months,after the finance ministry lifted its 2011 inflation forecast to4.0 percent from about 3.0 percent a, * Emerging products can generate huge business - Page (Adds details from call),SEOUL Apple Inc's Korean unit has paid compensation to a user of its popular iPhone after collecting location data without consent, lawyers and court officials said, the first payout by the company over these complaints.,SEOUL Apple Inc's  Korean unit has paid compensation to a user of its popular iPhone after collecting location data without consent, lawyers and court officials said, the first payout by the U.S. company over these complaints., * Payout is first related to unauthorised collection oflocation data (Adds no comment from Apple Korea spokesman, detail on U.S.suits),GIHEUNG, South Korea A study commissioned by Samsung Electronics rejected assertions that employees may have been exposed to carcinogenic chemicals at its plants, as several cancer-stricken former employees of the world's top memory chipmaker seek compensation for their illnesses., GIHEUNG, South Korea, July 14 A study commissioned by SamsungElectronics rejected assertions that employees may have been exposedto carcinogenic chemicals at its plants, as several cancer-stricken formeremployees of the world's top memory chipmaker seek compensation for theirillnesses., SEOUL, July 14 Apple Inc's Korean unithas paid compensation to a user of its popular iPhone aftercollecting location data without consent, lawyers and courtofficials said, the first payout by the U.S. company over thesecomplaints.

Title: Samsung LED files complaint against Osram in U.S.,UPDATE 1-Samsung LED files complaint against Osram in U.S.,Samsung LED files complaint to bar Osram LED imports to U.S.
Body: SEOUL Samsung LED Co. Ltd. said it had filed a complaint with the U.S. fair trade commission to ban imports of LED products from Siemens' (SIEGn.DE) light bulb unit Osram and affiliates Osram Opto Semiconductors and Osram Sylvania Inc., * Osram says well prepared for any Samsung complaint(Adds comment from Osram spokesman), SEOUL, Jul 17 Samsung LED Co., Ltd. has filed acomplaint with the United States fair trade commission to banimports of LED products from Siemens(SIEGn.DE) light bulb unitOsram and its affiliates Osram Opto Semiconductors and OsramSylvania Inc., the Korean firm said on Sunday.

Title: Hynix Q2 profit tumbles on weak demand from PC makers,Second RIM staffer defects to Samsung; Apple weighs,UPDATE 2-Second RIM staffer defects to Samsung; Apple weighs,Kodak shopping around tech patents,UPDATE 2-Kodak shopping around tech patents, shares rise,UPDATE 3-Samsung takes shot at iPad with new Galaxy Tab,Samsung launches new Galaxy Tab to close gap with iPad,UPDATE 7-Apple smashes Street views, shares soar
Body: SEOUL, July 21 Hynix Semiconductor Inc , the world's No.2 computer memory chip maker,reported on Thursday its quarterly operating profit dropped 56percent from a year ago, hit by weak demand from computermakers.,TORONTO Samsung Electronics has poached a second employee from Research In Motion in a month, setting back the BlackBerry maker as it struggles to regain its stride.,* Move comes at inopportune time for Canadian tech giant,NEW YORK Eastman Kodak is shopping around its patents for digital imaging, responding to investor complaints that the photography company has failed to capitalize on red-hot demand for tech patents.,   * Kodak studying options for 10 pct of its U.S. patents, * Worldwide tablet market set to surge to 70 mln this year,  , * Shares in Samsung, Hon Hai, Apple suppliers rise in Asia

Body: * Q2 operating loss 48 bln won vs consensus fcast 40 bln wonloss, SEOUL, July 21 The chief executive of HynixSemiconductor , the world's second-biggest computermemory chipmaker, expects the company's 2012 DRAM bit growth toexceed the market average of 40 to 50 percent from this year.,NEW YORK Tablets using Microsoft Corp software saw stronger sales than the high-profile Playbook from BlackBerry maker Research In Motion in the second quarter, according to Strategy Analytics., NEW YORK, July 21 Tablets using Microsoft Corp software saw stronger sales than the high-profilePlaybook from BlackBerry maker Research In Motion  inthe second quarter, according to Strategy Analytics., SEOUL, July 21 South Korean flat-screen maker LGDisplay revised down its 2011 capital expenditureplan by around 1 trillion won ($948 million) to the low to mid 4trillion won range on Thursday, as it struggles with stubbornlyweak panel demand from TV manufacturers., SEOUL, July 21 South Korean flat-screen maker LGDisplay posted its third consecutive quarterly lossas depressed demand from television makers outweighed roaringgrowth in sales to its main tablet- and smartphone-screen buyer,Apple Inc ., * Q2 op profit 447 bln won vs consensus fcast of 431 bln won

Body: WASHINGTON/SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc won a preliminary ruling from a U.S. trade panel that Taiwanese handset maker HTC Corp infringed on two of the California company's patents., * HTC says it will "vigorously fight" infringement finding (Rewrites first line, adds details on the case, Apple commentand background),HELSINKI/STOCKHOLM Mobile phone maker Sony Ericsson forecast an upturn in the second half, as it posted a first quarterly loss since 2009 due to a parts shortage stemming from the March 11 earthquake and tsunami in Japan. |__, * Q2 pretax loss 42 mln euros, vs forecast profit 4.9 mln, * TSMC testing manufacture of next generation chip - source, TAIPEI, July 15 Taiwan's TSMC hasstarted trial manufacturing of next generation A6 chips forApple Inc , a source familiar with the matter said, in asign that the iPad maker is shifting from its traditional chipsupplier, Samsung Electronics .

Title: Apple files fresh patent complaint against HTC,Apple files fresh patent complaint against HTC,Elpida to raise $990 million for new chips
Body: SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc has filed a fresh complaint against Taiwanese smartphone maker HTC Corp with a U.S. trade panel over unspecified portable electronic devices and software, according to the panel's web site., SAN FRANCISCO, July 11 Apple Inc  hasfiled a fresh complaint against Taiwanese smartphone maker HTCCorp  with a U.S. trade panel over unspecifiedportable electronic devices and software, according to thepanel's web site.,TOKYO Elpida Memory Inc plans to raise nearly 80 billion yen ($992 million) through new shares and convertible bonds as it shifts production away from DRAM memory to more profitable smartphone chips.

Body: SEOUL Sony Corp is considering pulling out of its LCD joint venture with South Korea's Samsung Electronics, a media report said on Wednesday., SEOUL, July 27 Japan's Sony Corp isconsidering pulling out of its LCD joint venture with SouthKorea's Samsung Electronics , a media report said onWednesday.,NEW YORK Motorola Solutions Inc lost a bid to dismiss a class-action lawsuit accusing it of misleading shareholders about deteriorating prospects for its cellphone business, resulting in investment losses., * Motorola said to hide weak prospects for its cellphones, * Sees sequential rise in industry revenue in currentquarter

Title: Kodak did not infringe on Apple patents, says ITC,UPDATE 2-Kodak did not infringe on Apple patents, says ITC
Body: WASHINGTON The International Trade Commission on Monday upheld a decision by one of its judges that Eastman Kodak did not infringe Apple Inc patents for digital cameras., WASHINGTON, July 18 The International TradeCommission on Monday upheld a decision by one of its judgesthat Eastman Kodak  did not infringe Apple Inc patents for digital cameras.

Body: SEOUL, July 29 Samsung Electronics Co , the world's top memory chipmaker, reported a 2  5 percent fall in quarterly profit as itsflat screen business posted a second consecutive quarterlyloss , overshadowing strong profit growth from handsetsales., * Sony's Q1 profit falls 59 pct to 27.5 bln yen vs mkt fcast15.2 bln, (Corrects Panasonic's operating profit in fifth-last paragraph), (Changes to sales from OP in summary and to sales fromoperating profit in 5th paragraph), SEOUL, July 28 South Korean top mobile carrierSK Telecom on Thursday applied for licenses for twoof the three spectrum bands up for sales, a spokeswoman said., SEOUL, July 28 Samsung Electronics Co said on Thursday it would pay 500 won ($0.476) pershare in interim dividend, just a tenth of last year's payout,as it struggles with slowing profit growth.,TOKYO Panasonic Corp  posted a 93 percent fall in quarterly operating profit on Thursday, hammered by production difficulties following the devastating March 11 earthquake in northeast Japan., * Panasonic Q1 profit slides on quake-related productionwoes, TOKYO, July 28 Panasonic Corp posted a93 percent fall in  quarterly operating profit onThursday, hammered by production difficulties following thedevastating March 11 earthquake in northeast Japan.,TOKYO Sony Corp stuck with its full-year profit forecast after slashing its outlook for TV sales, confident that other units will perform better than earlier anticipated to offset additional losses in the unit.

Body: WASHINGTON, July 27 A trade panel that hearspatent disputes has agreed to investigate Samsung ElectronicsCo's  complaint that Apple Inc  infringedits patented technology.,NEW YORK Corning Inc  slashed its forecast for the glass market and warned that manufacturers including Sony Corp  and Samsung  are worried about weak TV sales over the holiday season., NEW YORK, July 27 Corning Inc  slashedits forecast for the glass market and warned that manufacturersincluding Sony Corp  and Samsung  areworried about weak TV sales over the holiday season., TOKYO, July 27 Japan's Advantest Corp ,the world's No.2 maker of equipment to make chips, said ordersrose a quarterly 14 percent to the highest level in nearly fouryears, adding to evidence of resilience in the chip market.,  , SEOUL, July 27 LG Electronics expected on Wednesday third-quarter profits and sales would fallfrom the previous quarter due to reduced handset volumeshipments, and as demand for home appliances was seen weakening., SEOUL, July 27 LG Electronics posted  a 25 percent annual rise in quarterly profit onWednesday, as its handset business sharply reduced losses andits television division returned to a small profit.,SEOUL Japan's Sony Corp, struggling with a lossmaking television business, on Wednesday denied a media report it was considering pulling out of its LCD joint venture with South Korea's Samsung Electronics., SEOUL, July 27 Japan's Sony Corp ,struggling with a lossmaking television business, on Wednesdaydenied a media report it was considering pulling out of its LCDjoint venture with South Korea's Samsung Electronics .

Body: SEOUL/SAN FRANCISCO A German court has temporarily barred Samsung Electronics from selling its flagship Galaxy tablet in most of the European Union in a significant victory for market leader Apple Inc. |__,SEOUL/SAN FRANCISCO A German court has temporarily barred Samsung Electronics from selling its flagship Galaxy tablet in most of the European Union in a significant victory for market leader Apple Inc., * Samsung to launch new Galaxy tablet in Australia in Sept, * Apple won injunctions against Samsung Galaxy Tab inEurope, Australia,TOKYO Toshiba Corp, the world's No.2 maker of flash memory, on Wednesday warned that profits in its chip business could fall short of expectations, citing weak PC sales, faltering U.S. and European economies and a higher yen., * Toshiba: could fall short of H1 chip business op forecastof Y55 bln,NEW DELHI Samsung Electronics, which has been locked in a patent infringement battle with Apple Inc, on Wednesday said a German court order to temporarily bar its flagship Galaxy tablet in the European Union would not affect its launch plans in Australia and India., NEW DELHI, Aug 10 Samsung Electronics , which has been locked in a patent infringementbattle with Apple Inc , on Wednesday said a German courtorder to temporarily bar its flagship Galaxy tablet in theEuropean Union would not affect its launch plans in Australiaand India., TOKYO, Aug 10 Toshiba Corp , the world'sNo.2 maker of flash memory, said on Monday that its prices haveheld up in a tough market that has seen a sharp fall in spotprices of NAND., SEOUL, Aug 10 Samsung Electronics said on Wednesday that it would contest a German court'sdecision to bar the South Korean company from selling its GalaxyTab 10.1 in the European Union except the Netherlands.

Title: Google's bold bet on Motorola could hit Asian handset makers,Google-Motorola tie-up may draw antitrust scrutiny,CORRECTED - Google-Motorola tie-up may draw antitrust scrutiny,UPDATE 1-Toshiba to design LCD TVs in India, Vietnam - Nikkei,COLUMN-Google-Motorola is good news for Quinn Emanuel: Frankel,REFILE-UPDATE 2-Huawei closes in on Ericsson, sees growth in consumer sector,Taiwan's HTC says to increase China outlets
Body: SEOUL, Aug 16 Asian handset vendors such as HTC and Samsung Electronics could facepressure after Google Inc swooped in to buy MotorolaMobility Holdings Inc for $12.5 billion to help protectits fast-growing Android mobile operating system.,NEW YORK Google Inc, already the subject of antitrust inquiries, likely opened itself up to more regulatory scrutiny with its proposed $12.5 billion cash acquisition of Motorola Mobility Holdings Inc., (Corrects name of law firm in paragraph 17 to Shearman &Sterling LLP instead of Shearman & Stearling), Aug 16 Toshiba Corp will begindesigning LCD televisions for local markets in India, Indonesiaand Vietnam in October to challenge Samsung Electronics Co and other South Korean rivals, the Nikkei businessdaily reported.,   -- Alison Frankel writes the On the Case blog for ThomsonReuters News & Insight (http://newsandinsight.com). The viewsexpressed are her own. --, HONG KONG, Aug 15 China's Huawei Technologies CoLtd , the world's No.2 network equipment maker, postedan 11 percent rise in its first-half sales as it closes in onmarket leader Ericsson ., TAIPEI, Aug 15 HTC , the world's No. 5smartphone maker, said on Monday it would triple its Chinaoutlets to 2,000 by end of this year from 650 now.

Title: Too little exercise, too much TV tied to depression
Body: Older women who got more exercise and less television time were the least likely to be diagnosed with depression, according to a U.S. study of thousands of women -- with physical activity having the biggest impact.

Title: Atmel sees weak sales to iPad rivals in Q4, shares fall,UPDATE 2-Atmel sees weak sales to iPad rivals in Q4, shares fall,SK Telecom, KT to launch iPhone 4S in S.Korea Nov 11,Seoul shares recover losses helped by auto, tech issues

Title: Samsung delays new Android model release after Jobs death,Samsung delays new Android model release after Jobs death
Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co said on Monday it had delayed launching a new smartphone based on Google's latest version of Android operating system due to the death of Apple's co-founder Steve Jobs. |__,SEOUL, Oct 10 Samsung Electronics Co said on Monday it had delayed launching a new smartphone basedon Google's latest version of Android operating systemdue to the death of Apple's co-founder Steve Jobs.

Title: HTC tumbles again; growth potential in doubt
Body: TAIPEI Unnerved by a second profit warning in a month, investors sent HTC Corp shares tumbling for a second straight day on Friday on concern the world's No.4 smartphone maker may be running out of ideas in an increasingly competitive market.

Title: Seoul shares rise 2.2 pct on tech issues, builders,RPT-Samsung says expects to top 2011 smartphone sales target,Samsung says expects to top 2011 smartphone sales target,Samsung says expects to top 2011 smartphone sales target
Body: SEOUL, Nov 28 Seoul shares ended up 2.2percent on Monday after posting their biggest weekly fall innine weeks, with gains led by technology stocks and buildersincluding Samsung Electronics and Daewoo Engineering& Construction.,SEOUL, Nov 28 Samsung Electronics expects to beat its 2011 smartphone sales targetthanks to brisk sales of its Galaxy smartphones, a mobileexecutive said on Monday.,SEOUL Samsung Electronics expects to beat its 2011 smartphone sales target thanks to brisk sales of its Galaxy smartphones, a mobile executive said on Monday.,SEOUL, Nov 28 Samsung Electronics expects to beat its 2011 smartphone sales targetthanks to brisk sales of its Galaxy smartphones, a mobileexecutive said on Monday.

Title: U.S. judge rejects Apple bid to halt Galaxy sales,UPDATE 3-U.S. judge rejects Apple bid to halt Galaxy sales,U.S. judge rejects Apple bid to halt Galaxy sales
Body: Apple failed to convince a U.S. judge to block Samsung Electronics from selling Galaxy smartphones and tablets in the U.S. market, depriving the iPhone and iPad maker of crucial leverage in a global patent battle between the two companies.,Dec 2 Apple failed to convince a U.S.judge to block Samsung Electronics from sellingGalaxy smartphones and tablets in the U.S. market, depriving theiPhone and iPad maker of crucial leverage in a global patentbattle between the two companies.,Dec 2 A U.S. judge rejected Apple's attempt to halt U.S. sales of some Galaxy smartphones andtablets made by Samsung Electronics, according to aruling on Friday.

Title: Samsung plans flash chip line in China,UPDATE 2-Samsung plans flash chip line in China,Exclusive: Apple versus Samsung ruling divulges secret details,Samsung Ele says eyes NAND chip plant in China,Samsung Elec says new Austin plant reaches full capacity
Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics said on Tuesday it plans to build a flash memory chip plant in China, seen costing some $4 billion, as a boom in smartphones and tablet computers is set to fuel the $22 billion chip industry's growth next year.,SEOUL, Dec 6 Samsung Electronics said on Tuesday it plans to build a flash memorychip plant in China, seen costing some $4 billion, as a boom insmartphones and tablet computers is set to fuel the $22 billionchip industry's growth next year.,A court error on Friday offered a brief glimpse at information that Apple Inc and Samsung Electronics have tried to shield from the public during their high-stakes patent litigation.,SEOUL, Dec 6 Samsung Electronics, the world's top memory chip maker, said on Tuesdayit would seek talks to build a chip factory in China, with agoal of starting its operations in 2013.,SEOUL, Dec 6 Samsung Electronics said on Tuesday that its new $3.6 billion chip plantin Austin, Texas had reached full production capacity in recordtime, positioning it to cater to strong demand for smartphonesand tablet PCs.

Title: Samsung Elec promotes chip, display head,Electronics firms to pay $388 mln in LCD settlement

Body: SYDNEY/SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co won a round of its bruising global patent fight with Apple Inc on Friday when an Australian court lifted a ban on the sale of its Galaxy tablet computer in time for the busy Christmas shopping season.,* French court rejects Samsung's bid to ban sales of iPhone4S,SYDNEY An Australian court on Friday lifted a ban on the sale of Samsung Electronics' Galaxy tablet computer in the country, adding to a U.S. legal victory for the South Korean technology firm in its bruising battle with Apple Inc.,* Court rejects appeal to stay sales of Galaxy tablet inAustralia,SYDNEY, Dec 9 An Australian court onFriday lifted a ban on the sale of Samsung Electronics' latest Galaxy tablet in the country, allowing theSouth Korean firm to resume sales of the device for theChristmas shopping season.,SEOUL A French court rejected a request by Samsung Electronics Co to impose a preliminary sales ban on Apple's latest iPhone, Samsung said on Friday, as the two firms are locked in a bruising global patent war.,SEOUL, Dec 9 A French court rejected arequest by Samsung Electronics Co to impose apreliminary sales ban on Apple's latest iPhone, Samsungsaid on Friday, as the two firms are locked in a bruising globalpatent war.

Title: Bharti says in partnership with Samsung in Africa
Body: NEW DELHI, Dec 8 Bharti Airtel said on Thursday it will have exclusive distribution rights forsome of Samsung Electronics Co's wireless productsin 17 African countries for the first six months after theirlaunch, under a two-year partnership pact signed between thefirms.

Title: Samsung scores rare patent win versus Apple,UPDATE 4-In Australia, Samsung scores rare patent win vs Apple,Samsung wins appeal on Galaxy tab ban in Australia,UPDATE 2-Corning slashes outlook in glass glut, shares drop

Title: Exclusive: Made in Texas: Apple's A5 iPhone chip,Galaxy and iPhone to top smartphone holiday sales,Galaxy and iPhone to top smartphone holiday sales
Body: SAN FRANCISCO - Apple Inc is famous for relying on low-cost Asian manufacturers to both source and assemble its popular gadgets, but the consumer device giant recently started receiving a critical component in its iPad and iPhones from closer to home - Texas.,HELSINKI Apple's long-awaited iPhone 4S and Samsung Electronics' fresh, broad offering are likely to stand out in this holiday season's smartphone sales which will otherwise be clouded by global economic uncertainty.,HELSINKI, Dec 16 Apple's long-awaited iPhone 4Sand Samsung Electronics' fresh, broad offering are likely tostand out in this holiday season's smartphone sales which willotherwise be clouded by global economic uncertainty.

Title: Sony to sell LCD venture stake to Samsung for $940 million,UPDATE 3-Sony to sell LCD venture stake to Samsung for $940 mln,Samsung Elec says approves acquisition of LED JV,Sony: to revise earnings forecast for 2011/12,Sony agrees to end LCD venture with Samsung: source,Sony agrees to end LCD venture with Samsung -source
Body: TOKYO/SEOUL Sony Corp has agreed to sell its nearly 50 percent stake in an LCD joint venture with Samsung Electronics to the South Korean company for $940 million, as it struggles to reduce huge losses at its TV business.,* Venture with Samsung to end, Sony seeks cheaper LCD source,SEOUL, Dec 26 Samsung Electronics said on Monday that its board had approved its planto acquire its LED joint venture with parts affiliate SamsungElectro-Mechanics to enhance the competitiveness ofthe business.,TOKYO, Dec 26 Sony Corp said onMonday it expects the sale of its share in an LCD panel jointventure with Samsung Electronics to result in aroughly 66 billion yen ($845 million) impairment loss in theOctober-December quarter.,TOKYO/SEOUL Sony Corp has agreed to end its LCD joint venture with Samsung Electronics and will sell its stake to the South Korean company, a source familiar with the matter said on Monday.,TOKYO, Dec 26 Sony Corp hasagreed to end its LCD joint venture with Samsung Electronics and will sell its stake to the South Koreanmanufacturer, a source said.

Title: Seoul shares dip 0.5 pct as tech issues ease,Samsung to post strong Q4 on record smartphone sales

Title: Sony says executive changes not yet determined,Sony says executive changes not yet determined
Body: TOKYO Japan's Sony Corp said on Saturday that nothing had been determined about executive officer changes, after media reported consumer business chief Kazuo Hirai would take over the role of president from Howard Stringer as early as April.,TOKYO, Jan 7 Japan's Sony Corp said on Saturday that nothing had been determined aboutexecutive officer changes, after media reported consumerbusiness chief Kazuo Hirai would take over the role of presidentfrom Howard Stringer as early as April.

Title: Whirlpool accuses Samsung, LG of dumping washers
Body: Whirlpool Corp  on Friday accused two South Korean rivals, Samsung Electronics  and LG Electronics , of dumping washing machines in the United States by selling them "at substantially less than fair value."

Title: Samsung unveils new tablet, available via Verizon,CES: Samsung aims for 16 percent boost in 2012 TV sales
Body: LAS VEGAS Samsung Electronics Co unveiled its latest tablet using a 7.7-inch OLED display on Monday, and said the product will be available through U.S. mobile carrier Verizon Wireless.,LAS VEGAS Samsung Electronics Co, the world's biggest TV manufacturer, expects the global television market to grow around 7 to 8 percent this year, and aims to grow at double that rate with a company sales target of around 50 million sets.

Title: Olympus considering capital tie-up -media,Samsung will focus more on profit than handset volume,CES-Samsung CEO:To focus more on profit than handset sales volume

Title: Samsung may consider alliance with Olympus: source,Samsung open to "alliance" with Olympus: source,UPDATE 4-Samsung may consider alliance with Japan's Olympus - source,Samsung open to "alliance" with Olympus, but not in cameras -source,Olympus says mulling options, no decision on equity tie,Samsung Elec no longer interested in Olympus buy -Samsung source
Body: SEOUL/TOKYO South Korea's Samsung Electronics is open to forging an alliance with Japan's troubled Olympus Corp, potentially joining other electronics firms in circling one of the world's biggest names in medical equipment, sources said.,SEOUL Samsung Electronics is not interested in Olympus Corp's camera business, but the South Korean company may consider an alliance with the Japanese firm in other areas, a Samsung source told Reuters.,* Short-lists Sony, Panasonic, Samsung, Fujifilm & Terumo -Asahi,SEOUL, Jan 12 Samsung Electronics is not interested in Olympus Corp's camerabusiness, but the South Korean company may consider an alliancewith the Japanese firm in other areas, a Samsung source toldReuters.,TOKYO, Jan 12 Olympus said onThursday it was considering various options for reform butnothing had been decided, following a Japanese newspaper reportthat it was considering an equity alliance with five prospectiveinvestors including electronics groups Sony, Panasonic and Samsung Electronics.,SEOUL, Jan 12 Samsung Electronics has decided not to bid for Japan's Olympus Corp because it saw little synergy from the combination interms of technology and branding, a source at the South Koreancompany told Reuters on Thursday.

Title: Samsung expands patent row with Apple in Germany,Samsung expands patent row with Apple in Germany

Title: Analysis: BlackBerry licensing seen RIM's likeliest scenario

Title: GSM phones vulnerable to hijack scams: researcher

Title: Samsung seen taking cellphone crown from Nokia: poll
Body: HELSINKI Korea's Samsung Electronics Co Ltd ended Nokia Oyj's 14-year leadership of the global cellphone market in the first quarter of the year, outselling the struggling Finnish handset maker for the first time ever, according to a Reuters poll of analysts.

Title: Analysis: Smart logic: Samsung chips away at Intel lead
Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics, already a world leader in TVs and smartphones, is taking the fight to Intel Corp for the No.1 slot in semiconductors, betting on strong growth in so-called logic chips that are the brains inside today's fast-selling smart mobile devices.

Title: Samsung's crisis culture: a driver and a drawback

Body: SAN JOSE, California Apple Inc spent years developing its iconic iPhone, but Samsung took a shortcut by copying its rival's designs after realizing it could not keep up, an Apple attorney said as the high-stakes patent infringement trial drew towards a climax.,SEOUL, Aug 22 Following is a list of events inSouth Korea as well as news stories and press reports that mayinfluence financial markets.     TOP STORIES>Apple, Samsung make final arguments to U.S. jury  >Electrolux among 3 bidders for Daewoo Elec        >Elpida to submit Micron restructuring plan        >Japan hints at economic action in S.Korea island  >Apple, Samsung CEOs talk but no trial settlement  >Korean coffee craze may be hit by curbs            ,SAN JOSE, Calif., Aug 21 Apple Inc O>spent years developing its iconic iPhone, but Samsung took ashortcut by copying its rival's designs after realizing it couldnot keep up, an Apple attorney said as the high-stakes patentinfringement trial drew towards a climax.,SAN JOSE, Calif., Aug 21 Apple spent four yearspouring resources into developing the iconic iPhone, whileSamsung couldn't keep up and eventually decided to copy itsmajor competitor, an Apple attorney said in court.,SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co said on Tuesday it will spend about $4 billion at its chip plant in Austin, Texas, to renovate an existing chip producing line and boost production of system chips, widely used in popular smartphones and tablets.,SEOUL, Aug 21 Samsung Electronics Co said on Tuesday it will spend about $4 billion at its chip plantin Austin, Texas, to renovate an existing chip producing lineand boost production of system chips, widely used in popularsmartphones and tablets.,SAN JOSE, Calif., Aug 20 The chief executives ofApple Inc and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd have talked but did not settle the high stakes patent disputebetween the two electronics companies, a Samsung attorney saidin court on Monday.

Body: * LG Display falls after brokerage downgrade    * Foreign selling weighs on market    SEOUL, Oct 5 Seoul shares edged up on Fridayafter bellwether Samsung Electronics postedstronger-than-expected earnings, but a dimmer outlook cappedprice gains.    Shares in Samsung Electronics, which makes up over 15percent of the benchmark KOSPI, ended up 0.22 percentafter rising as much as 1.68 percent earlier in the day after itestimated a record quarterly profit of $7.3 billion, powere,SEOUL, Oct 5South Korean shares ended slightlyhigher on Friday, with heavyweight Samsung Electronics finishing up 0.22 percent after reportingbetter-than-expected earnings estimates.,SEOUL Samsung Electronics reported a record quarterly profit of $7.3 billion, nearly double last year's figure, as strong sales of high-end TVs and Galaxy smartphones more than offset reduced orders for chips and screens from Apple Inc, its main rival and leading customer. |__,* Q4 profit may dip on competition, marketing, bonuses -analysts,SEOUL, Oct 5 Seoul shares edged up on Fridaymorning but pared earlier gains as weakness in LG Display Co Ltd and builders weighed on the market following aninitial boost from Samsung Electronics Co's robustearnings guidance.,SEOUL, Oct 5 The South Korean won rose toits highest in almost a year in early trade on Friday afterstrong earnings guidance from Samsung Electronics Co. lifted the stock market.      The won was quoted at 1,110.6 against the dollaras of 0025 GMT, compared with Thursday's local close of 1,113.8.It hit a high of 1,109.6, the strongest since Oct. 31, 2011.     The benchmark Korea Composite Stock Price Index wasup 0.4 percent at 2,000.03. Samsung Electronics said it expectsa re,SEOUL, Oct 5 South Korean shares edged higher onFriday after Samsung Electronics Co estimated recordthird quarter profits, beating already high expectations.

Title: Seoul index moves above 2,000 on foreign and programmed buying,Samsung at record high; pushes Seoul shares over 2,000-mark,TEXT-Fitch: Samsung - Limited Room for Upgrade Despite Performance
Body: * Computerized buying highest in three months    * Samsung Elec gains 2.9 pct to record high    By Somang Yang    SEOUL, Dec 13 South Korean shares closed attheir highest level since Sept. 24, as gains rooted in foreigninterest increased due to computerised buying related toexpiring options and futures.    The Korea Composite Stock Price Index (KOSPI) rose27.33 point, or 1.4 percent, to end at 2,002.77 points. It hadbeen nearly 11 weeks since the last close above 2,000.   ,SEOUL, Dec 13 South Korean shares closed up at athree-month high on Thursday after the country's central bankheld interest rates steady amid more easing from the U.S.Federal Reserve.,SEOUL, December 13 (Fitch) Samsung Electronics Co., Ltd.'s(Samsung, 'A+'/Stable) ratings are constrained in the 'A'category due to the cyclical and capital-intensive nature of itsbusiness operations, which result in low operating and FCFmargins compared with other 'A' and 'AA' category technologycompanies rated by Fitch. This is despite record operatingresults in 2012, and indications of strong investor confidence.

Tech shares are expected to see amixed session," said Cho Byung-hyun, an analyst at Tong YangSecurities.     Signs of further weakening in the yen could triggersell-offs, Cho sa,NEW YORK U.S. retail investors who have gone sour on Apple Inc after the drubbing the stock has been taking may want to think twice before trying to buy its main smartphone rival, Samsung Electronics Co Ltd, at least in American markets.,NEW YORK, Jan 24 U.S. retail investors who havegone sour on Apple Inc after the drubbing the stock hasbeen taking may want to think twice before trying to buy itsmain smartphone rival, Samsung Electronics Co Ltd,at least in American markets.,SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co, due to report record earnings on Friday, may cut capital spending by as much as a fifth this year - a first reduction since the global financial crisis - as demand for computer chips weakens and rival Apple Inc looks set to buy fewer of its microprocessors used in the iPhone and iPad.,* Samsung shares up 12 pct in 4 months; Apple down a third,NEW YORK, Jan 24 U.S. retail investors who havegone sour on Apple Inc after the drubbing the stock hasbeen taking may want to think twice before trying to buy itsmain smart phone rival, Samsung Electronics Co Ltd,at least in American markets.

Body: SEOUL, Jan 31 Following is a list of events inSouth Korea as well as news stories and press reports that mayinfluence financial markets:       TOP STORIES>RIM -- now BlackBerry -- launches new BB10 line    >Donors meet target of $1.5 bln aid for Syrians     >Lenovo sets sights overseas in smartphone push     >S.Korea, Thailand warn over fallout from easy money >Nintendo to post loss as Wii successor falters                MARKETS>S.Korean won falls afte,BRUSSELS, Jan 30 EU regulators are consideringcharging more firms with anti-competitive practices in usinginjunctions to prevent rivals using their patents rather thannegotiating fair fees, a month after taking action againstSamsung Electronics, the EU's antitrust chief saidon Wednesday.,Jan 30 South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co did not willfully infringe on some of Apple Inc's patents, a U.S. federal court has ruled, foilingApple's attempt to ratchet up the $1.05 billion in damages itwas awarded last August by a U.S. jury.,* Samsung Electronics extends gains after US court ruling,SEOUL, Jan 30 A U.S. court has ruled thatSamsung Electronics Co did not willfully infringe onsome of Apple Inc's patents and denied a request by theU.S. firm to raise patent damages awarded to it in its legaldispute against the South Korean firm, a court ruling showed onWednesday.

Title: Judge cuts Apple award versus Samsung, sets new damages trial
Body: Apple Inc had a major setback in its mobile patents battle with Samsung Electronics on Friday, as a federal judge slashed a $1.05 billion jury award by more than 40 percent and set a new trial to determine damages.

Title: TEXT-S&P Rpt: Smartphones Pressure Korean Telecoms, Buoy Samsung
Body: HONG KONG (Standard & Poor's) Jan. 18, 2013--The risingpopularity of smartphones sets the competitive landscape forrelated industries, especially telecommunications and handsetmanufacturing markets, to evolve significantly over the nextseveral years, Standard & Poor's Ratings Services said in areport published today.

Title: Sony looking to beat Chinese rivals to be No.3 in smartphones,Samsung Electronics shares rise after Apple award nearly halved

Title: Samsung's next reinvention challenge: itself

Title: Fitch: Samsung and Apple to Lose Global Smartphone Market Share
Body: (The following statement was released by the rating agency)SINGAPORE/SYDNEY, August 12 (Fitch) Samsung's and Apple's globalsmartphone shipment market share will decline to around 25% and 14%,respectively, by 2015 (2013: 31% and 15%), says Fitch Ratings. The decline will be duelargely to rising competition in emerging markets, where lower-pricedhandset models from local competitors should continue to gain market share at theexpense of the big two. In these markets, where cost is relati

Title: U.S. judge rejects Apple bid for injunction against Samsung,UPDATE 2-U.S. judge rejects Apple bid for injunction against Samsung,U.S. judge rejects Apple bid for injunction against Samsung,Apple planning 12.9-inch iPad for 2015: Bloomberg
Body: SAN FRANCISCO A U.S. judge rejected Apple Inc's latest bid for a permanent injunction against Samsung Electronics Co Ltd in another sign of the diminishing impact of the smartphone patent wars.,SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 27 A U.S. judge rejectedApple Inc's latest bid for a permanent injunctionagainst Samsung Electronics Co Ltd in another signof the diminishing impact of the smartphone patent wars.,SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 27 A U.S. judge on Wednesdayrejected a bid from Apple Inc for a permanentinjunction against Samsung Electronics Co Ltd overthree Apple patents that went to trial earlier this year.,SAN FRANCISCO Apple Inc  is preparing to roll out a larger, 12.9-inch version of its iPad for 2015, with production set to begin in the first quarter of next year, Bloomberg cited people with knowledge of the matter as saying on Tuesday.

Title: Samsung buys U.S. air conditioner firm Quietside in 'smart home' push
Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Tuesday it had acquired U.S. air conditioner distributor Quietside LLC as part of its push to strengthen its "smart home" business.

Title: Apple planning 12.9-inch iPad for 2015 -Bloomberg
Body: SAN FRANCISCO, Aug 26 Apple Inc ispreparing to roll out a larger, 12.9-inch version of its iPadfor 2015, with production set to begin in the first quarter ofnext year, Bloomberg cited people with knowledge of the matteras saying on Tuesday.

Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  on Tuesday issued unexpectedly weak quarterly earnings guidance which put it on track for its worst results in two years and cast doubt on the smartphone gadgets like thermostatsand light bulbs to talk to each other, at odds with a frameworkbacked by Qualcomm, LG Electronics andother companies.,* Samsung Elec's weak Q2 earnings guidance sours Title: Montreal startup taps crowdfunding for virtual reality headset,Montreal startup taps crowdfunding for virtual reality headset
Body: TORONTO A tiny Montreal company is turning to crowdfunding in hopes of moving its virtual reality headset from a working prototype to a mass produced rival to products from Facebook, Samsung and Sony.,TORONTO, Sept 16 A tiny Montreal company isturning to crowdfunding in hopes of moving its virtual realityheadset from a working prototype to a mass produced rival toproducts from Facebook, Samsung and Sony.

Title: Samsung accuses rival LG exec of vandalizing washing machines,Samsung accuses rival LG exec of vandalising washing machines

Title: Reliance Jio raises $750 mln loan from Korea Exim Bank
Body: MUMBAI, Sept 25 Reliance Jio Infocomm, thetelecommunications arm of India's Reliance Industries Ltd, said it had raised a $750 million loan from KoreaExim Bank to finance the purchase of telecoms infrastructurefrom Samsung Electronics.

Title: South Korea powers up downtown duty-free sales as China tourism magnet
Body: SEOUL Already the world's biggest duty-free market, South Korea said on Wednesday it will issue more licenses for downtown duty-free shops, doubling down on a strategy that has helped it outstrip  regional rivals seeking to reel in shopaholic Chinese tourists.

Title: Samsung shares could gain as much as 50 percent -Barron's
Body: Oct 12 Shares of Samsung Electronics appear cheap and could gain as much as 50 percent, Barron'sfinancial newspaper said in its latest edition.

Title: Samsung Electronics CEO hoses down chip war fears
Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd does not expect a price war to break out in the semiconductor industry next year even though it is ramping up capacity, the chief executive of the world's biggest memory chip maker said on Tuesday.

Title: Intel gains a new ally in China's chip wars: Beijing,Intel gains a new ally in China's chip wars - Beijing
Body: BEIJING/SAN FRANCISCO Intel's investment of up to $1.5 billion in two fast-growing Chinese mobile chipmakers has effectively aligned the U.S. giant with a third party - a Beijing government intent on producing a viable domestic challenger to the likes of Qualcomm and Samsung.,BEIJING/SAN FRANCISCO, Oct 14 Intel's investmentof up to $1.5 billion in two fast-growing Chinese mobilechipmakers has effectively aligned the U.S. giant with a thirdparty - a Beijing government intent on producing a viabledomestic challenger to the likes of Qualcomm and Samsung.

Title: Microsoft plans to launch smartwatch within weeks -Forbes
Body: NEW YORK, Oct 19 Microsoft Corp. ispreparing to launch a smartwatch within the next few weeks thatwill passively track a user's heart rate and work acrossdifferent mobile platforms, Forbes reported on Sunday.

Title: Apple must face U.S. lawsuit over vanishing iPhone text messages
Body: Apple Inc  was ordered to face a U.S. federal lawsuit claiming it failed to tell consumers that its messaging system would block them from receiving text messages if they switched to Android-based smartphones from iPhones.

Title: Samsung loses bid to freeze Microsoft's U.S. lawsuit over royalties,UPDATE 1-Samsung loses bid to freeze Microsoft's U.S. lawsuit over royalties,Samsung loses bid to freeze Microsoft's U.S. lawsuit over royalties

Body: HANOI South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  has applied for a license to invest $3 billion in building a second smartphone factory in northern Vietnam, a government official said on Monday.,* To build second smartphone factory in Thai Nguyen province,HANOI, Nov 10 A subsidiary of South Korea'sSamsung Electronics Co Ltd will be awarded a licenceto invest $3 billion in a mobile phone plant in northernVietnam, the second such facility in the country, a state-runnewspaper said on Monday.

Title: Samsung Elec shares up sharply on $2 bln share buyback plan
Body: SEOUL, Nov 27 Shares of South Korean tech giantSamsung Electronics Co Ltd opened sharply higher onThursday on the news that it will buy back $2 billion of its ownstock.

Title: UPDATE 1-Taiwan probe finds 12 smartphone brands violate privacy rules
Body: TAIPEI, Dec 5 Taiwan has identified 12smartphone brands that do not conform with privacy standards,and the handset makers could face fines or a ban unless theyaddress the breaches, an official at the telecoms regulator saidon Friday.

Body: SEOUL South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Friday it's considering lifting its 2014 dividend payout by up to 50 percent, its latest attempt to boost its share price in a year plagued by disappointing earnings.,* Poor results brought pressure to return more capital (Adds analyst comment, details on share performance),SEOUL, Dec 19 South Korea's Samsung ElectronicsCo Ltd said on Friday it is considering increasingits dividend payout for 2014 by between 30 percent and 50percent compared with the previous year.,SEOUL, Dec 19 Shares in Samsung Electronics rose more than 4 percent early on Friday after localmedia said the electronics giant had decided to increasedividend payouts to boost shareholder value.

Title: Samsung Electronics exits fibre optics amid sharper focus on reviving smartphones,Samsung Electronics exits fibre optics amid sharper focus on reviving smartphones,UPDATE 1-Samsung Electronics exits fibre optics amid sharper focus on reviving smartphones,Samsung Electronics to sell fibre optics business to Corning

Title: For Qualcomm, China settlement may be just the beginning,UPDATE 1-China's Xiaomi raises $1.1 bln from investors at $45 bln valuation,For Qualcomm, China settlement may be just the beginning,For Qualcomm, China settlement may be just the beginning
Body: SAN FRANCISCO/BEIJING The settlement of China'santitrust probe into Qualcomm Inc is likely tointensify global scrutiny of the firm's highly profitable patentlicensing business, and may even call into question itsworldwide contracts with smartphone makers such as Apple andSamsung.,BEIJING, Dec 29 China's Xiaomi Inc, oneof the world's fastest-growing smartphone makers, has raised$1.1 billion in a round of funding that cements its status asone of the world's most valuable private technology companies ata valuation of $45 billion.,SAN FRANCISCO/BEIJING The settlement of China's anti-trust probe into Qualcomm Inc is likely to intensify global scrutiny of the firm's highly profitable patent licensing business, and may even call into question its worldwide contracts with smartphone makers such as Apple and Samsung.,SAN FRANCISCO/BEIJING, Dec 29 The settlement ofChina's anti-trust probe into Qualcomm Inc is likely tointensify global scrutiny of the firm's highly profitable patentlicensing business, and may even call into question itsworldwide contracts with smartphone makers such as Apple andSamsung.

Title: Samsung Elec to buy Brazil printing solutions firm
Body: SEOUL, Jan 31 South Korea's Samsung ElectronicsCo Ltd said on Saturday that it would acquireBrazilian printing solutions company Simpress, the latest dealby the tech giant to bolster its business-to-businessoperations.

Title: Samsung to buy mobile payment service provider LoopPay

Title: Samsung Electronics earmarking cash for growth, including M&A
Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd aims to use its $56 billion cash pile to fund growth including acquisitions, the tech giant's investor relations chief said, even as more shareholders clamor for bigger dividends.

Title: S.Korea's Samsung SDI to buy Magna's car battery pack business

Title: Smartphone rivals Apple, Samsung fight common enemy with appeal,Companies in cathode ray tube price fixing lawsuit reach $528 million deal
Body: Fighting side by side for a change, Apple andSamsung on Monday said they will appeal a ruling by a Texasfederal judge who refused to halt patent holder Smartflash LLCfrom pursuing its cases against them while its patents arescrutinized by the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office.,SAN FRANCISCO Five companies including Samsung SDI Co Ltd and Koninklijke Philips agreed to pay a total of $528 million to resolve a class action lawsuit alleging price fixing in the market for cathode ray tubes, according to a court filing.

Title: In $8 bln Samsung bid, some Koreans break ranks to side with foreign activist

Title: U.S. fund Elliott seeks injunction to block Samsung's $8 billion asset shake-up
Body: SEOUL U.S. activist hedge fund Elliott is taking legal action to block  a move by the family that runs Samsung Group to cement its grip on the conglomerate, asking a Seoul court to stop an $8 billion merger of two Samsung sister firms that the fund says is unfair.

Title: South Korea court to rule on U.S. fund's bid to block Samsung deal by July 1
Body: SEOUL A South Korean court on Friday said it will rule by July 1 on U.S. hedge fund Elliott's injunction request to block a Samsung C&T Corp  shareholder vote on an $8 billion takeover bid from Cheil Industries Inc .

Title: Samsung Group firms, in deal battle, may boost shareholder returns: sources
Body: SEOUL Two Samsung Group firms are looking at options to boost shareholder returns on completion of their proposed $8 billion merger, people familiar with the matter said, as the companies seek to overcome opposition from a U.S. hedge fund.

Title: Federal Circuit greenlights $548 million Samsung payout to Apple
Body: Apple is another step closer to finally receiving the morethan $548 million it is owed by Samsung for infringing itspatents and designs on the iPhone, after a last-ditch effort tohold off the payment failed on Tuesday in the nation's toppatent court.

Title: Samsung Electronics says Q3 profit up 82 pct vs year earlier

Title: Asia's factories struggle with global demand gulf
Body: SYDNEY Activity in China's colossal factory sector shrank in October as global demand stuttered, reinforcing the case for more stimulus and questioning whether the Federal Reserve can be confident enough to raise U.S. interest rates this year.

Title: Apple's verdict survives latest challenge by Samsung
Body: A U.S. appeals court on Thursday again rejected SamsungElectronics' call to review a $548 million judgment for AppleInc. in the companies' seemingly never-ending and hard-foughtwar over the technology and design of smart phones and tablets.

Title: Culture shock: Samsung's mobile woes rooted in hardware legacy
Body: SINGAPORE/SEOUL Efforts to revive its once stellar smartphone fortunes may be doomed if Samsung Electronics cannot overcome its dominant engineering culture, according to serving and former executives and those who have dealt with the company.

Body: The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday stepped intothe high-profile patent fight between the world's two fiercestsmartphone rivals, Apple and Samsung, agreeing to hear Samsung'sappeal of what it contends were excessive penalties for copyingthe patented designs of the iPhone.,The U.S. Supreme Court on Monday stepped into the high-profile patent fight between the world's two fiercest smartphone rivals, Apple and Samsung, agreeing to hear Samsung's appeal of what it contends were excessive penalties for copying the patented designs of the iPhone.,March 21 The U.S. Supreme Court on Mondaystepped into the high-profile patent fight between the world'stwo fiercest smartphone rivals, Apple and Samsung, agreeing tohear Samsung's appeal of what it contends were excessivepenalties for copying the patented designs of the iPhone.,WASHINGTON, March 21 The U.S. Supreme Court onMonday stepped into the high-profile patent fight between theworld's two fiercest smartphone rivals, Apple and Samsung,agreeing to hear Samsung's appeal of what it contends wereexcessive penalties for copying the patented designs of theiPhone.

Title: Samsung asks for emergency stay of damages retrial with Apple
Body: In the wake of a decision by the U.S. Supreme Court to hearSamsung's appeal on damages related to design patentinfringement, the company has asked a federal judge to postponea retrial with Apple scheduled to begin in less than a week.

Title: Samsung Electronics says to acquire U.S. appliances maker Dacor,Samsung Elec says to acquire US appliances maker Dacor

Title: REFILE-Samsung Electronics says bought cloud service firm Joyent for $170 mln
Body: SEOUL, Aug 16 South Korea's Samsung ElectronicsCo Ltd, the world's biggest smartphone maker, saidon Tuesday it bought U.S. cloud services firm Joyent Inc in Junefor 185.3 billion won ($170 million).

Title: Samsung punished with triple damages in patent case,Samsung, Tencent surge in race to become Asia's most valuable firm
Body: A federal judge has tripled the damages Samsung ElectronicsCo Ltd owes for infringing two digital photography patents, to$21 million, after admonishing the company for misrepresentingfacts and offering false testimony at trial.,SINGAPORE Tencent Holdings Ltd  and Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  are racing to be crowned Asia's most valuable company as expectations for robust earnings growth push their share prices to record highs. |__

Title: China's BYD forecasts up to 91 pct profit rise for first nine months
Body: BEIJING, Aug 28 Chinese automaker BYD Co Ltd , backed by Warren Buffett's BerkshireHathaway Inc, on Sunday predicted an up to 91-percentprofit increase in the first nine months of the year, asgovernment policies drive green car sales.

Title: Hyundai Merchant Marine in talks with Samsung, LG to ship their cargo
Body: SEOUL, Sept 5 Hyundai Merchant Marine Co Ltd is in talks with South Korean firms such as homeappliance makers Samsung and LG to carry their cargo, thechairman of South Korea's Financial Services Commission toldreporters on Monday.

Title: Samsung Electronics shares trade at new record intraday high,Samsung Electronics shares trade at new record intraday high

Body: SEOUL In its rush to beat rival products to market, notably Apple's  new iPhone, Samsung Electronics  has accelerated new phone launch cycles, but its haste is raising concerns that it fell short on quality testing.,* Samsung issued unprecedented global recall for Galaxy Note7

Body: BEIJING China's quality watchdog said on Wednesday Samsung Electronics Co Ltd's  local unit will recall 1,858 units of its Galaxy Note 7 phones, after the Korean firm's product was found to have fire-prone batteries.,* Samsung previously said China phones used differentbatteries,BEIJING, Sept 14 China's quality watchdog saidon Wednesday Samsung Electronics Co Ltd's local unitwill recall 1,858 units of its Galaxy Note 7 phones, after theKorean firm's product was found to have fire-prone batteries.,SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd , which has urged users of its Galaxy Note 7 smartphone to turn them in due to fire-prone batteries, said it will perform a software update in South Korea that limits the devices' charge to 60 percent.,SEOUL, Sept 14 Samsung Electronics Co Ltd, which has urged users of its Galaxy Note 7smartphone to turn them in due to fire-prone batteries, said itwill perform a software update in South Korea that limits thedevices' charge to 60 percent.

Title: Fitch Affirms HP Inc.'s IDR at 'BBB+/F2' on Samsung Printer Business Acquisition,Samsung to replace or refund one million U.S. Galaxy Note 7 phones
Body: (The following statement was released by the rating agency)CHICAGO, September 16 (Fitch) Fitch Ratings has affirmed theratings for HP Inc. (HP), including the Long- and Short-Term Issuer Default Ratings(IDR) at 'BBB+/F2', on HP's acquisition of Samsung's printer business.The Rating Outlook is Stable. Fitch's action affects $10.8 billion of total debt,including the undrawn $4 billion revolving credit facility (RCF). A full listof ratings follows at the end of this release.Fitch expect,Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  formally recalled 1 million Galaxy Note 7 smartphones sold in the United States, replacing or refunding the flagship phones, whose susceptibility to catching fire has damaged the image of the Korean powerhouse. |__

Title: U.S. carrier Verizon starts taking orders for new Samsung Note 7 phones,U.S. carrier Verizon starts taking orders for new Samsung Note 7 phones
Body: SEOUL U.S. carrier Verizon Communications Inc  has begun taking orders for Samsung Electronics Co Ltd's  new Galaxy Note 7 smartphones, after having stopped sales of the device earlier due to fire-prone batteries.,SEOUL, Sept 21 U.S. carrier VerizonCommunications Inc has begun taking orders for SamsungElectronics Co Ltd's new Galaxy Note 7 smartphones,after having stopped sales of the device earlier due tofire-prone batteries.

Title: Samsung phone emits smoke on Indian airline flight,UPDATE 1-Samsung phone emits smoke on Indian airline flight,Samsung phone emits smoke on Indian plane mid-air, no damage
Body: NEW DELHI A Samsung Electronics smartphone stored in an overhead baggage compartment on an Indian plane emitted smoke in mid-flight on Friday, India's aviation regulator said, but there was no damage and the aircraft landed safely.,NEW DELHI, Sept 23 A Samsung Electronics smartphone stored in an overhead baggage compartmenton an Indian plane emitted smoke in mid-flight on Friday,India's aviation regulator said, but there was no damage and theaircraft landed safely.,NEW DELHI, Sept 23 A Samsung Electronics smartphone sent smoke from an overhead baggagecompartment on an Indian commercial plane during a flight onFriday, India's aviation regulator said, but there was no damageand the aircraft landed safely.

Body: LOUISVILLE, Ky. A replacement model of thefire-prone Samsung Note 7 smartphone began smoking inside a U.S.plane on Wednesday, the family that owns it said, promptingfresh investigations by the Consumer Product Safety Commissionand the Federal Aviation  Administration.,SEOUL Tech giant Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Thursday it is acquiring U.S. artificial intelligence (AI) platform developer Viv Labs Inc, a firm run by a co-creator of Apple Inc's Siri voice assistant program.,SEOUL, Oct 6 Tech giant Samsung Electronics CoLtd said on Thursday it is acquiring U.S. artificialintelligence (AI) platform developer Viv Labs Inc, a firm run bya co-creator of Apple Inc's Siri voice assistantprogramme.,Oct 5 The following bids, mergers, acquisitionsand disposals were reported by 2100 GMT on Wednesday:,FRANKFURT Dialog Semiconductor , the maker of chips used in Apple and Samsung Electronics' smartphones, said it was reviewing its full-year guidance after a Chinese holiday helped bolster third-quarter sales.,FRANKFURT, Oct 5 Dialog Semiconductor,the maker of chips used in Apple and Samsung Electronics'smartphones, said it was reviewing its full-year guidance aftera Chinese holiday helped bolster third-quarter sales.,Oct 5 A Southwest Airlines Co flight toBaltimore was evacuated on Wednesday after a replaced SamsungElectronics Co Ltd Note 7 device started emittingsmoke while the plane was at the boarding gate, according to theVerge.,* Southwest Airlines - Prior to flight 994 departing fromLouisville for Baltimore,customer reported smoke emitting fromSamsung electronic device,Oct 5 Activist investor Elliott Management urgedSamsung Electronics Co Ltd to explore a "demerger",splitting into a listed holding company and a listed operatingcompany.,* Company, Potter Capital Llc, who are affiliates ofElliott, sent a letter to board of samsung electronics

Title: Samsung Electronics says Q3 operating profit likely rose 5.6 pct y/y,Elliott push for Samsung makeover puts founding family plans under microscope,Replacement Samsung Note 7 phone emits smoke on U.S. plane: family,PRESS DIGEST - Wall Street Journal - Oct 6,UPDATE 4-Replacement Samsung Note 7 phone emits smoke on U.S. plane -family,REFILE-S.Korea stocks edge up as Samsung Electronics hits record high,Samsung Electronics investor Henderson says it backs Elliott restructuring proposals,Samsung Elec investor APG Asset Management says Elliott proposals 'common sense',Samsung Elec investor APG Asset Management says Elliott proposals 'common sense',Samsung Electronics investor Henderson says it backs Elliott restructuring proposals
Body: SEOUL, Oct 7 Samsung Electronics Co said it expects third-quarter operating profit rose 5.6 percent,beating estimates, as a pickup in chip and display businesslikely offset the impact of a global recall of its Galaxy Note 7smartphone.,SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co  shares jumped to a record high on Thursday after activist investor Elliott Management submitted unsolicited proposals for a radical corporate makeover at the world's biggest smartphone maker. |__,LOUISVILLE, Ky. A replacement model of the fire-prone Samsung Note 7 smartphone began smoking inside a U.S. plane on Wednesday, the family that owns it said, prompting fresh investigations by the Consumer Product Safety Commission and the Federal Aviation  Administration.,Oct 6 The following are the top stories in theWall Street Journal. Reuters has not verified these stories anddoes not vouch for their accuracy.,LOUISVILLE, Ky., Oct 5 A replacement model ofthe fire-prone Samsung Note 7 smartphone began smoking inside aU.S. plane on Wednesday, the family that owns it said, promptingfresh investigations by the Consumer Product Safety Commissionand the Federal Aviation Administration.,(Corrects misspelling of KOSPI)    * KOSPI touches 1-wk intraday high    * Market also awaiting Samsung Elec earnings guidance-analyst    SEOUL, Oct 6 South Korean shares edged up earlyon Thursday as market heavyweight Samsung Electronics hit a record high after saying it would carefullyreview a restructuring proposal made by U.S. hedge fund ElliottManagement late Wednesday.     Elliott, an activist investor which owns 0.62percent of Samsung shares, proposed splitting S,SINGAPORE A minority investor in Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Thursday it supports proposals submitted by U.S. hedge fund Elliott Management for restructuring the South Korean technology giant to improve shareholder value.,SEOUL Dutch pension fund APG Asset Management, an investor in South Korea's Samsung Electronics Co Ltd, is positive about proposals submitted by U.S. hedge fund Elliott Management to restructure the tech giant, a director said on Thursday.,SEOUL, Oct 6 Dutch pension fund APG AssetManagement, an investor in South Korea's Samsung Electronics CoLtd, is positive about proposals submitted by U.S.hedge fund Elliott Management to restructure the tech giant, adirector said on Thursday.,SINGAPORE, Oct 6 A minority investor in SamsungElectronics Co Ltd said on Thursday it supportsproposals submitted by U.S. hedge fund Elliott Management forrestructuring the South Korean technology giant to improveshareholder value.

Body: SEOUL Tech giant Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Sunday it was delaying the start of new Galaxy Note 7 smartphone sales in South Korea by three days to Oct. 1, a move it says is needed for speedy completion of the ongoing recall in the country.,* S.Korea Note 7 sales to restart on Oct 1 vs Sept 28previously,SEOUL, Sept 25 Tech giant Samsung Electronics CoLtd said on Sunday it was delaying the start of newGalaxy Note 7 smartphone sales in South Korea by three days toOct. 1, a move it says is needed for speedy completion of theongoing recall in the country.

Title: AT&T stops Note 7 replacements after reports of fire
Body: Oct 9 AT&T Inc said on Sunday it will stopexchanging Samsung Electronics' Galaxy Note 7following reports of fires from the replacement devices.

Body: SEOUL, Oct 14 Samsung Electronics Co Ltd on Friday said it expects to take a hit to itsoperating profit of about $3 billion over the next two quartersdue to the discontinuation of its fire-prone Galaxy Note 7smartphone.,SEOUL Samsung Electronics on Thursday offered refunds or financial incentives for U.S. and South Korea customers who exchange Note 7s for other products, as the tech giant scrambles to shore up its reputation after a damaging phone safety crisis. |__,* Offers up to a $100 total bill credit to U.S. consumerswho exchange a Note 7 for any Samsung model,SEOUL South Korea's central bank conceded on Thursday that Samsung Electronics Co Ltd's smartphone crisis could potentially hamper economic growth, but largely maintained its view that the country's recovery is still on track.,TAIPEI Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co (TSMC) raised its forecast for 2016 revenue after setting new profit and sales records in the third quarter, as analysts said it was riding high on supplying parts for Apple Inc's new iPhone 7.,* 'Demand for high-end smartphones still rising' - co-CEO (Adds executive comment on Samsung smartphone woes),* C.bank governor sees little change in economy from lastmonth (Adds S&P, Moody's statements on Samsung),* Moody's -  Samsung Electronics' Galaxy Note 7 productionhalt is credit negative,* U.S. Consumer Product Safety Commission - Samsung expandsrecall of galaxy note7 smartphones based on additional incidentswith replacement phones,SEOUL, Oct 13 Samsung Electronics onThursday offered financial incentives for customers in SouthKorea who exchange Galaxy Note 7 smartphones for other Samsungmodels, as it scrambles to shore up its reputation in the wakeof a damaging safety crisis.

Title: Singapore Airlines bans Samsung Galaxy Note 7 on its flights,U.S. bans Samsung Galaxy Note 7 smartphones from air travel,Singapore Airlines bans Samsung Galaxy Note 7 on its flights
Body: SINGAPORE Singapore Airlines  said on Saturday it has banned Samsung's Galaxy Note 7 mobile phones from all its flights and any passenger carrying one will not be allowed to board its planes.,WASHINGTON Samsung Galaxy Note 7 smartphone devices will be banned from aircraft in the United States starting on Saturday at noon EDT (1600 GMT) under an emergency order, regulators said on Friday after numerous reports of the devices catching fire. |__,SINGAPORE, Oct 15 Singapore Airlines said on Saturday it has banned Samsung's Galaxy Note 7 mobilephones from all its flights and any passenger carrying one willnot be allowed to board its planes.

Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Sunday it would launch an artificial intelligence digital assistant service for its upcoming Galaxy S8 smartphone, seeking to rebound from the Galaxy Note 7's collapse and differentiate its devices.,* Tech firms' competition on AI technology intensifying (Updates with background on Samsung),SEOUL, Nov 6 Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Sunday it would launch an artificialintelligence digital assistant service for its upcoming GalaxyS8 smartphone, seeking to rebound from the Galaxy Note 7'scollapse and differentiate its devices.

Body: WASHINGTON Samsung Galaxy Note 7 smartphone devices will be banned from aircraft in the United States starting on Saturday at noon EDT (1600 GMT) under an emergency order, regulators said on Friday after numerous reports of the devices catching fire. |__,SAN FRANCISCO/SEOUL San Francisco Bay Area risk consultant Gil Oliva is willing to risk that his Samsung Galaxy Note 7 smartphone might catch fire, shrugging off a global recall that has damaged the South Korean manufacturer's reputation and raised questions about its future.,SAN FRANCISCO/SEOUL, Oct 14 San Francisco BayArea risk consultant Gil Oliva is willing to risk that hisSamsung Galaxy Note 7 smartphone might catch fire, shrugging offa global recall that has damaged the South Korean manufacturer'sreputation and raised questions about its future.,WASHINGTON, Oct 14 Samsung Galaxy Note7smartphone devices will be banned from air transportation in theUnited States starting Saturday at noon EDT (1600 GMT) under anemergency order, regulators said Friday.,MUMBAI, Oct 15 Samsung Electronics Co on Friday offered alternative phones to its Indiacustomers who had pre-ordered its flagship Galaxy Note 7devices, in a bid to appease loyal clients in one of its largestsmartphone markets.,SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co.'s smartphone crisis is likely to ripple through to the foreign exchange market, analysts say, putting the South Korean won under pressure as the global tech giant takes a multi-billion dollar earnings hit from lost sales.,SEOUL, Oct 14 Samsung Electronics Co.'s smartphone crisis is likely to ripple through to theforeign exchange market, analysts say, putting the South Koreanwon under pressure as the global tech giant takes amulti-billion dollar earnings hit from lost sales.,* Shareholders need further reassurance - Lee, de facto head of SouthKorea's sprawling Samsung Group, accelerated taking a board seatat flagship unit Samsung Electronics partly becauseof investor pressure to improve governance, two people familiarwith the matter said.

Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics has agreed to buy Harman International Industries in an $8 billion deal, marking a major push into the auto electronics market and the biggest overseas acquisition ever by a South Korean company.,* Marks biggest overseas acquisition by S.Korea group (Adds Breakingviews link),* Deal with Samsung  provides, upon termination of mergerunder certain circumstances, termination fee of $240 million tobe payable by coSource text for Eikon: [http://bit.ly/2fRRW2c]Further company coverage:,* Says its unit Samsung Electronics America will raise9,338.49 billion won through rights issue in proceeds forinvestment fund,* Samsung electronics to acquire Harman, accelerating growthin automotive and connected technologies,SEOUL, Nov 14 Samsung Electronics said on Monday it had agreed to buy Harman InternationalIndustries for about $8 billion, a deal that enables theSouth Korean electronics giant to expand its presence in theautomotive electronics market.

Title: Galaxy Note 7 recall did not damage Samsung brand in U.S.: Reuters/Ipsos poll
Body: SAN FRANCISCO A global recall of fire-prone Galaxy Note 7 smartphones did not appear to hurt U.S. consumers' willingness to buy Samsung Electronics  phones, a Reuters/Ipsos opinion poll released on Sunday showed.

Title: As Samsung moves on from Note 7 crisis, SDI battery affiliate struggles,As Samsung moves on from Note 7 crisis, SDI battery affiliate struggles

Title: South Korea third-quarter GDP growth revised down as Samsung smartphone crisis bites
Body: SEOUL South Korea's economy grew a slightly slower 0.6 percent during the July-September quarter in sequential terms, revised data showed on Friday, as handset exports lagged more than expected due to Samsung Electronics killing off its Galaxy Note 7 smartphone earlier this year.

Title: UPDATE 5-Samsung Electronics considers split as investor pressure builds,Five things to know about Samsung Electronics' holding company review,Five things to know about Samsung Electronics' holding company review,Samsung sets cautious tone with activist fund,Samsung Elec mulls holding company move, boosts payout,REFILE-CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Samsung Elec mulls holding company move, boosts payout,CORRECTED-UPDATE 2-Samsung Elec mulls holding company move, boosts payout,BRIEF-Samsung Elec says still not certain on merits of US listing,Samsung Elec says not considering merger of a holding firm and Samsung C&T
Body: * Firm also boosting 2016 dividend, to buy back more shares (Adds statement from Elliott affiliates, background, details),SEOUL Tech giant Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  said on Tuesday it is considering whether to create a holding company as part of a corporate restructuring review.,SEOUL, Nov 29 Tech giant Samsung Electronics CoLtd said on Tuesday it is considering whether tocreate a holding company as part of a corporate restructuringreview.,HONG KONG (Reuters Breakingviews) - Samsung Electronics has set a cautious tone with activist investor Elliott Management. The South Korean conglomerate says it will consider using a holding company structure. It's a measured but welcome response to the U.S. fund's restructuring proposals. Plans to boost dividends and buy back more stock also show the group is serious about improving relations with shareholders.,,* Samsung says conducting review for optimal corporatestructure,* Samsung says conducting review for optimal corporatestructure,* Says will consider potential U.S listing after decidingwhether to adopt holding company structure,SEOUL, Nov 29 Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Tuesday it has no plans at present toconsider a merger between a holding company and Samsung C&T Corp in its ongoing structural review.

Title: Samsung Group leader vows to avoid future political scandals
Body: SEOUL, Dec 6 Samsung Group leader Jay Y. Leesaid on Tuesday he will work to ensure South Korea's topconglomerate avoids becoming involved in scandals such as thecurrent influence-peddling allegations surrounding PresidentPark Geun-hye.

Title: Samsung to disable Note 7 phones in the U.S. via software update
Body: Samsung Electronics Co Ltd said on Friday that a software update for Galaxy Note 7 smartphones will be released mid-December in the United States preventing them from charging and functioning as mobile phones, rendering them useless.

Title: Sharp-Foxconn JV to stop supplying Samsung with TV panels to stem losses
Body: TOKYO Japan's Sharp Corp and Taiwan's Foxconn have decided to stop supplying television panels through their joint venture to Samsung Electronics Co Ltd as they review the money-losing unit, a person familiar with the matter said.

Title: Samsung Electronics likely to procure phone batteries from LG Chem: Chosun Ilbo
Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd is in talks with LG Chem Ltd to make it one of its smartphone battery suppliers, the Chosun Ilbo newspaper said on Monday - a move that would diversify its supplier base after the failure of its Galaxy Note 7.

Title: Samsung Elec surges to record high on payout growth hopes,Samsung Electronics considers split as investor pressure builds,REFILE-UPDATE 2-Samsung Elec surges to record high on payout growth hopes
Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  added $9 billion to its market value on Wednesday as shares in the South Korean tech giant soared to record highs, buoyed by promises of greater capital returns and a review of its corporate structure.,SEOUL Tech giant Samsung Electronics Co Ltd , under pressure from shareholders to improve investor returns, said on Tuesday it will consider creating a holding company in what would be the biggest shake-up in its 47-year history. |__,SEOUL, Nov 30 Samsung Electronics Co Ltd added $9 billion to its market value on Wednesday asshares in the South Korean tech giant soared to record highs,buoyed by promises of greater capital returns and a review ofits corporate structure.

Title: Samsung Electronics CEO says firm should make no product quality compromise
Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  should make no compromises on the quality of its products, Chief Executive Kwon Oh-hyun said on Monday, asking employees to improve manufacturing processes and safety inspections.

Title: Samsung Electronics in talks with LG Display for LCD panel supply: Yonhap,Samsung's chip, screen sales to drive Q4 profit to 3-year high -analysts
Body: SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd is in talks with South Korea's LG Display Co Ltd about a potential liquid crystal display (LCD) panel supply deal for televisions, South Korea's Yonhap News Agency reported on Wednesday.,SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd is likely to forecast its best quarterly profit in nearly three years on Friday, analysts said, with robust memory chip sales easing the pain of the costly failure of a flagship smartphone.

Title: Apple plans first retail store in South Korea, posts hiring notices,Samsung Electronics forecasts fourth-quarter profit at over three-year high,China nibbles at Samsung share to take 50 pct of India's smartphone market
Body: SEOUL Apple Inc  said it was planning to open a retail store in South Korea, its first in the country that is home to its smartphone archrival Samsung Electronics Co Ltd . |__,SEOUL Samsung Electronics Co Ltd  said on Friday its fourth-quarter profit likely leapt 50 percent from a year earlier to its highest level in more than three years, beating expectations on strong chip sales and a smartphone rebound. |__,MUMBAI, Jan 6 Chinese brands took their largestever slice of the $10-billion Indian smartphone market in late2016, accounting for more than one in every two phones sold - agrowing market share that ate into sales from top-sellingSamsung Electronics.

Title: U.S. Supreme Court backs Samsung in smartphone fight with Apple
Body: The U.S. Supreme Court on Tuesday sided with Samsung in its big-money smartphone patent fight with Apple, throwing out an appeals court ruling that the South Korean company had to pay a $399 million penalty to its American rival for copying key iPhone designs.

Title: Samsung Elec says to hold Galaxy Note 7 press briefing on Jan 23
